1.text: Better is the poor that walks in his integrity, than he that is perverse in his lips, and is a fool.

2.text: Also, that the soul be without knowledge, it is not good; and he that hastens with his feet sins.

3.text: The foolishness of man perverts his way: and his heart frets against the LORD.

4.text: Wealth makes many friends; but the poor is separated from his neighbor.

5.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaks lies shall not escape.

6.text: Many will entreat the favor of the prince: and every man is a friend to him that gives gifts.

7.text: All the brothers of the poor do hate him: how much more do his friends go far from him? he pursues them with words, yet they are wanting to him.

8.text: He that gets wisdom loves his own soul: he that keeps understanding shall find good.

9.text: A false witness shall not be unpunished, and he that speaks lies shall perish.

10.text: Delight is not seemly for a fool; much less for a servant to have rule over princes.

11.text: The discretion of a man defers his anger; and it is his glory to pass over a transgression.

12.text: The king’s wrath is as the roaring of a lion; but his favor is as dew on the grass.

13.text: A foolish son is the calamity of his father: and the contentions of a wife are a continual dropping.

14.text: House and riches are the inheritance of fathers: and a prudent wife is from the LORD.

15.text: Slothfulness casts into a deep sleep; and an idle soul shall suffer hunger.

16.text: He that keeps the commandment keeps his own soul; but he that despises his ways shall die.

17.text: He that has pity on the poor lends to the LORD; and that which he has given will he pay him again.

18.text: Chasten your son while there is hope, and let not your soul spare for his crying.

19.text: A man of great wrath shall suffer punishment: for if you deliver him, yet you must do it again.

20.text: Hear counsel, and receive instruction, that you may be wise in your latter end.

21.text: There are many devices in a man’s heart; nevertheless the counsel of the LORD, that shall stand.

22.text: The desire of a man is his kindness: and a poor man is better than a liar.

23.text: The fear of the LORD tends to life: and he that has it shall abide satisfied; he shall not be visited with evil.

24.text: A slothful man hides his hand in his bosom, and will not so much as bring it to his mouth again.

25.text: Smite a scorner, and the simple will beware: and reprove one that has understanding, and he will understand knowledge.

26.text: He that wastes his father, and chases away his mother, is a son that causes shame, and brings reproach.

27.text: Cease, my son, to hear the instruction that causes to err from the words of knowledge.

28.text: An ungodly witness scorns judgment: and the mouth of the wicked devours iniquity.

29.text: Judgments are prepared for scorners, and stripes for the back of fools.
